docs.text: imagine this scenario : you and any of your family members are scudding through one of those long , excruciating cross-country car trips , far from the city and into the deserted rural routes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so far , the trip is idyllic when , abruptly , your car malfunctions and you are stranded in the middle of nowhere .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is not an easy situation , but a perfectly plausible one , the panorama in which breakdown musters it's throbbing suspense and skillfully executed tautness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is not easy to cobble a distinct and gripping thriller nowadays , but breakdown doesn't bungle into rudimentary plot holes or cliches and it derives a masterful , titillating climax that by it's finale , engrosses a viewer with total absorption .

docs.text: the plot is somewhat reminiscent of 1988's the vanishing .

docs.text: kurt russell and kathleen quinlan respectively play jeff and amy taylor , a massachusetts couple en route to california for a brand new job .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when they stop for gas somewhere in the arid southwest , jeff is confronted by a pugnacious driver , who later , will be an important player in the plot department .

docs.text: minutes later after that , their brand new , strikingly red , jeep grand cherokee unexpectedly stops .

docs.text: kurt russell is one of the few top-notch hollywood actors which doesn't overblow his acting , and gradually gains reliance on his role as it progresses .

docs.text: so you can assume his alteration in breakdown is letter-perfect .

docs.text: suffice it is to say he undergoes a transformation , from a jolly man , to a guy frantically pursuing a loved one .

docs.text: not many well-paid actors can deliver these type of performances , but russell is one of them .

docs.text: as an everyday man , he pulls it off extremely convincingly , what also surprised me more was his rigorous physicality , which he effectively practices almost all throughout the films 93 minutes .

docs.text: although the film is blotted with a couple of portentous action sequences ( very well done ) yet the tightness is generated by the subtle circumstances this man is presented with .

docs.text: faced with an enigma about his wife's whereabouts , the movie succeeds by conveying us in realistic territory with veritable characters , including the cryptic villains , who in essence , make the movie what it is .

docs.text: what's most impressive however , is the feature debut by writer/director jonathan mostow .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: mostow , hitherto directed the showtime thriller flight of a black angle , alleviates the contrivances and generics of the script by gingerly pursuing the trajectory of the plot , efficiently letting the tone and the mood of the story generate that nail-biting suspense sought for in a well- made affair .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: contrary to most american thrillers , he doesn't rely on visual flair , but on aesthetics and substance .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after breakdown , he should gain vast notoriety .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the villains in the movie aren't your routine out-of-this-world idiosyncratic psychos that are harming for no particular objective .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the baddies in breakdown , all well acted , are normal , seemingly inoffensive townspeople who beneath their trustworthy layer , conduct an amoral business of corruption and murder .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie smartly portrays these men as loathsome rednecks , and , of all things in the world , it is becoming rather easy to root for villains ( jon voight in anaconda ) in today's movies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: worth a special mentioning is j . t walsh ( who previously worked with kurt russell in executive decision ) as the leader of the gang , he renders a deliciously wicked performance , temporarily stepping out of the minor roles he is known for .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: alfred hitchcock used suspense--and action-- not only to stimulate , but as a way of aiding his audience's fascination in his stories , which were slowly realizing man's biggest fears .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: breakdown yields exactly that .

docs.text: it magnificently taps into the psyche of an ordinary man , acting like an ordinary man , looking like an ordinary and some sort of superhero .
